intro: Polygala supina subsp. hospita, commonly known as the lying polygala, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Africa. It typically features slender, creeping stems that lie close to the ground, often forming dense mats. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight curl at the tips. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
